Italian Baked Pork Breakfast Casserole

Jump to Recipe

Start your day off right with this delicious Italian Baked Pork Breakfast Casserole! Packed with flavorful ground pork, vibrant bell peppers, and creamy mozzarella cheese, this hearty dish is perfect for family brunches or meal prep for busy mornings. With just a few simple ingredients like eggs, milk, and Italian seasoning, you can create a comforting breakfast option that’s not only satisfying but also easy to make. Whether you’re feeding a crowd or just looking for a tasty way to kickstart your day, this casserole is sure to impress. Get ready to awaken your taste buds and enjoy a slice of Italy with every bite!

Ingredients

ground pork

Choose lean ground pork for a healthier option, or substitute with ground turkey or chicken for a lighter casserole. If you prefer a richer flavor, try using ground beef or sausage. Make sure to cook the pork thoroughly to avoid any health risks.

eggs

Fresh eggs will yield the best flavor and texture. For a fluffier casserole, beat the eggs well before mixing with other ingredients. If you're looking for a dairy-free option, you can substitute eggs with a mixture of silken tofu or a commercial egg replacer.

milk

Use whole milk for creaminess, or substitute with almond milk or oat milk for a dairy-free version. You can also use half-and-half for a richer flavor. If you're watching your calories, consider using skim milk.

italian seasoning

You can easily make your own Italian seasoning using equal parts of dried basil, oregano, thyme, and rosemary. If you like a bit of heat, add a pinch of red pepper flakes. Fresh herbs can also be used if you have them on hand, but use them in larger quantities.

bell peppers (diced)

Any color of bell pepper works well, but red or yellow will add a sweeter flavor. If you don’t have bell peppers, zucchini or mushrooms can be good substitutes. For added flavor, roast the bell peppers before adding them to the mixture.

onion (diced)

Yellow onions are the most versatile for this recipe, but you can also use red onions for a slightly sweeter taste. To enhance the flavor, caramelize the onions before adding them to the skillet.

mozzarella cheese (shredded)

Fresh mozzarella will melt beautifully, but you can also use low-moisture mozzarella for a firmer texture. For a twist, try using provolone or fontina cheese. If you want a dairy-free option, use a plant-based cheese substitute.

parmesan cheese (grated)

Freshly grated Parmesan offers more flavor than pre-grated. If you need a substitute, Pecorino Romano can give a sharper taste. Nutritional yeast can be used for a dairy-free, cheesy flavor.

salt

Adjust the amount of salt based on your dietary needs or preferences. If using cheese in the recipe, you may want to reduce the salt since cheese can be quite salty.

black pepper

Freshly cracked black pepper will add more flavor than pre-ground. For a spicier kick, consider adding cayenne pepper or using white pepper for a milder taste.

olive oil

Extra virgin olive oil offers the best flavor. If you're looking for a lighter option, you can substitute with a vegetable oil or avocado oil. For added flavor, consider infusing the oil with garlic or herbs before using it.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Preheat the Oven

    Set your oven to 350°F (175°C) to preheat. This ensures that the casserole cooks evenly. Make sure to do this step first so that your oven is ready when you finish assembling the casserole.

  • Step 2: Sauté Vegetables

    In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Add 1 medium diced onion and 1 cup of diced bell peppers. Sauté until softened, which should take about 5 minutes. This step enhances the flavors of the vegetables, making them sweeter and more aromatic.

  • Step 3: Cook the Ground Pork

    Add 1 pound of ground pork to the skillet. Break it apart with a spatula and cook until browned and fully cooked through, which takes about 8-10 minutes. If there's excess fat, drain it off to keep the casserole from being greasy.

  • Step 4: Prepare the Egg Mixture

    In a large bowl, whisk together 6 eggs, 1 cup of milk, 1 tablespoon of Italian seasoning, 1 teaspoon of salt, and 1/2 teaspoon of black pepper until well combined. This mixture will bind all the ingredients together.

  • Step 5: Combine Ingredients

    Fold the cooked pork and vegetable mixture into the egg mixture. Then, add in 1 cup of shredded mozzarella cheese and half of the 1/2 cup of grated Parmesan cheese. Mix gently to combine without breaking the cheese.

  • Step 6: Transfer to Baking Dish

    Pour the combined mixture into a greased 9x13-inch baking dish. Make sure to spread it evenly. Sprinkle the remaining Parmesan cheese on top for a nice golden crust.

  • Step 7: Bake the Casserole

    Place the baking dish in the preheated oven and bake for 30-35 minutes. The casserole is done when it’s set in the middle and the top is golden brown. Check for doneness by inserting a knife in the center; it should come out clean.

  • Step 8: Cool and Serve

    Once baked, allow the casserole to cool for a few minutes before slicing into squares. This will help it hold its shape. Serve warm and enjoy your delicious Italian Baked Pork Breakfast Casserole!

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I properly prepare and chop vegetables like onions and bell peppers?

To chop onions, first cut off the top and root ends, then slice the onion in half. Peel the skin off, place the flat side down, and slice it vertically and horizontally to create small pieces. For bell peppers, cut off the top and bottom, remove the seeds and core, then slice into strips and dice as needed.

What is the best way to cook ground pork?

Ground pork should be cooked over medium heat until it reaches an internal temperature of 160°F (71°C). Break it apart with a spatula as it cooks. Ensure there’s no pink left when you’re done.

How do I know when my casserole is fully cooked?

Your casserole is done when it's set in the middle and the top is golden brown. You can also use a toothpick inserted in the center; it should come out clean.

Can I substitute ingredients in the recipe?

Absolutely! You can substitute ground pork with ground turkey or beef. For the cheeses, feel free to use a cheese you prefer, like cheddar. You can also use any vegetables you have on hand.

What is the purpose of adding milk to the egg mixture?

Adding milk makes the eggs creamier and helps create a fluffier texture in the casserole. It also adds moisture, which is essential for a good bake.

How do I safely store leftovers from my casserole?

Allow the casserole to cool completely, then cover it tightly with plastic wrap or aluminum foil and refrigerate. It should be consumed within 3-4 days. You can also freeze it for up to 3 months.

What should I do if I accidentally burn the top of my casserole?

If the top is burnt but the inside is cooked, you can carefully scrape off the burnt layer with a knife. Serve the casserole as is, and consider covering it with a bit of cheese or fresh herbs for added flavor.

Why is it important to let the casserole cool before slicing?

Cooling allows the casserole to set, making it easier to cut and serve without falling apart. It also helps retain moisture and flavor.

How can I make my casserole more flavorful?

You can enhance the flavor by adding garlic, fresh herbs, or even a splash of hot sauce or Worcestershire sauce to the egg mixture. Seasoning your vegetables with salt and pepper while cooking also helps.

What type of baking dish should I use?

A 9x13-inch baking dish is ideal for this casserole. Glass or ceramic dishes work well as they distribute heat evenly, but metal pans are also a good choice.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For a gluten-free option, ensure that the ingredients used (such as cheese and seasonings) are certified gluten-free. To make this dish lower in fat, consider using lean ground turkey instead of pork, or substitute half of the eggs with egg whites. For a vegetarian version, you could replace the ground pork with a hearty mix of sautéed mushrooms and spinach, while maintaining the other ingredients for flavor.

Pairings

This Italian Baked Pork Breakfast Casserole pairs beautifully with a fresh arugula salad dressed with lemon vinaigrette, which adds a peppery contrast to the richness of the casserole. For beverages, consider serving it with freshly brewed coffee or a mimosa made with sparkling wine and orange juice. If you're looking for something heartier, a light red wine like Chianti or a crisp white wine like Pinot Grigio will complement the savory flavors of the dish.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the casserole warm from the oven, garnished with freshly chopped parsley or basil for a pop of color and freshness. For a delightful brunch spread, accompany it with toasted slices of crusty Italian bread or focaccia drizzled with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. You can also offer a selection of condiments such as hot sauce or a spicy salsa for guests to customize their servings. Presentation in a decorative casserole dish can enhance the dining experience.

Italian Baked Pork Breakfast Casserole

60 min
$10
350 kcal
Difficulty: 30%
Servings: 6

Allergens:

DairyEggs

Dietary Tags:

High ProteinLow Carb

Cuisine:

Italian

Course:

BreakfastBrunch

Tags:

BreakfastCasseroleItalian

Description

A savory and hearty breakfast casserole loaded with Italian flavors, perfect for feeding a crowd!

Ingredients

  • ground pork: 1 pound
  • eggs: 6
  • milk: 1 cup
  • italian seasoning: 1 tablespoon
  • bell peppers (diced): 1 cup
  • onion (diced): 1 medium
  • mozzarella cheese (shredded): 1 cup
  • parmesan cheese (grated): 1/2 cup
  • salt: 1 teaspoon
  • black pepper: 1/2 teaspoon
  • olive oil: 1 tablespoon
